intro: Linostachys urticifolia, commonly known as the stinging nettle tree, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, stinging leaves that can cause irritation upon contact with the skin. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Linostachys urticifolia is also valued for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils, making it a common weed in various environments.
